title: U.S. adds just 235,000 jobs in August as delta dents hiring
text:
Congress will eventually bail out Social Security – but that will create another set of problems

A sudden, across-the-board Social Security benefit cut is almost impossible to conceive. See full story.

America's toxic ‘us vs. them' politics is now spilling into the stock market and polarizing investors

Mean-spirited chatter on investing topics is everywhere, from meme stocks to 'values' investing. See full story.

Apple stock closes at record high following concessions to Netflix, Spotify, other app makers

Apple Inc. shares closed at a record high Thursday after the most valuable U.S. company by market cap announced concessions for some large developers on its App Store regarding commissions, while those app makers' stocks also gained. See full story.

The U.S. needs to rejoin the TPP to meet the China challenge

Pacific free-trade agreement could help American businesses and workers compete in the technologies of the future. See full story.

MARKETWATCH PERSONAL FINANCE

Like 2012's Hurricane Sandy, Ida packs fresh lessons for how the U.S. must take precautions against climate change's more immediate impacts, especially floods. See full story.
